Based on the information in Table 1, which of the following best predicts a key difference in prokaryotes and eukaryotes with regard to transcription and translation?

choices.label: The two processes will occur simultaneously in prokaryotes but not eukaryotes.

Prokaryotic <math alttext="m R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is shorter than eukaryotic <math alttext="m R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Eukaryotic <math alttext="m R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> contains more coding regions than prokaryotic <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The processing of <math alttext="m R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> by eukaryotes is required for the <math alttext="m R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></math> to leave the nucleus.

content.answer: The two processes will occur simultaneously in prokaryotes but not eukaryotes.
